title: Project-Based Instructional Design for Reading Comprehension Strategies for Advanced Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic reading proficiency and exposure to social studies texts
context.additional_context: Project-based analysis and synthesis of social studies texts in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, emphasizing metacognitive strategy development through enhanced teacher-student interaction

learning_goals: Learners can utilize question-generation strategies to extract explicit/implicit information from texts across social domains

Learners will apply a metacognitive strategy (keyword extraction → logical structure diagramming → core sentence reconstruction) to summarize the main arguments of three social science texts (500–800 characters) within three sentences.

Based on at least three peer feedbacks and one teacher feedback, learners will write a 1,000-character reflective journal on reading strategy application results, establish at least three improvement plans, and implement them in the next learning phase.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
